fields.Name: Deconstructing Bitcoin + Tech: An Antidote to Fear
fields.Description:
Bitcoin has been built on a strong principled foundation with positive incentives, yet many of the stories and sometimes the experiences with bitcoin usage are frightening.

In the spirit of the upcoming White Paper birthday and Halloween, this project wants to help dispel fears and celebrate what makes bitcoin magic:

**I.**
**Spooky Stories**
Compare and contrast qualities of bitcoin vs. current financial systems vs. PoS, through Halloween cultural references. 

Create: Conceptual art

**II.**
**Mind Control Remedy**
Bitcoin's organic adoption magic rests in how its community encourages open learning and critical thinking. Sharing bitcoin's concepts should not be so scary. How can we simplify the process and make it more friendly? 

Create: An open library of visual elements that anyone can customize for presentations, workshops, and diagrams 

**III.**
**Dark Spell Removal**
Error messages may be one of the scariest moments when navigating through an app. How can we help make people feel empowered instead of afraid of what pops on their screen?

Create: List of error message options written with different tones so product makers may find one that fits their brand's personality 

Please join the [#designathon-deconstructing](https://bitcoindesign.slack.com/archives/C044VNT0KAT) Slack channel for updates, conversation & contributions. 

Contribute:
\- Error message screenshots
\- Concepts/diagrams you've had a difficult time explaining
\- Ideas
\- Art
\- ...

Thank you for your time.

For updates on the project: 
<https://www.alexaaker.com/library/deconstructing/bitcoin/index.html>

Figma Community file:
<https://www.figma.com/community/file/972290772932533325>

On Slack:
[#designathon-deconstructing](https://bitcoindesign.slack.com/archives/C044VNT0KAT)

fields.Name: [compactor]
fields.Description:
Problem: 
After using bitcoin for a while, or after mixing larger amounts of bitcoin using popular CoinJoin tools, users will accumulate many UTXOs in their wallet. This bloats the UTXO set. But more importantly for the user, this creates a privacy problem when the user wants to transfer an amount of bitcoin that is larger than any of the UTXOs in their wallet: to make this transfer, they will need to combine multiple UTXOs in their wallet into a single larger output, creating a public link between the inputs of the transaction and making it possible to infer common ownership of them. As the user collects more and more UTXOs, they become more and more cumbersome to manage while preserving privacy.

See also "common input ownership heuristic" and "unnecessary input heuristic" sections of the [privacy page in the bitcoin wiki](https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Privacy#Blockchain_attacks_on_privacy).

Solution: 
[compactor] is an app that is used to privately consolidate bitcoin UTXOs using a zero-knowledge sidechain (such as zSide by Nikita Chashchinskii) to consolidate bitcoin UTXOs in a way that does not create a public link between the UTXOs.

[Wireframes and further explanation](https://github.com/john-light/compactor/blob/main/docs/%5Bcompactor%5D%20-%20shared.pdf)

Slack channel: [#designathon-compactor](https://bitcoindesign.slack.com/archives/C0459PJFSBA)

fields.Name: Bcharge
fields.Description:
Problem:
Vehicle charging points availability away from home.

Solution:
Peer to peer app for offering and tapping into charging points for the cost of electricity + a bit of incentive, paid with btc.

For example I'm visiting another city and I want to charge my car at the best cost/KWh in proximity not caring about charge speed.
Or: I'd like to get to the fastest charging point available in the area with the cost/KWh being secondary.

Luckily I have this app (to be designed) where I can check the local carge points (offered by other users or companies), giving me the cost and characteristics of the dock, where I can pay with btc/ln to tap in for a set period of time.

By Raz. Join in [#designathon-bcharge](https://bitcoindesign.slack.com/archives/C0468STBJVA).

fields.Name: Visualize cryptography
fields.Description:
As self custody becomes more mainstream, the seed phrase will be normalized. However, I think we may be able to do more to help folks understand the power of the seed phrase during the creation and restoration process. When you create a seed phrase on a Ledger or other signing device, you get a sense that the seed phrase is not purely random and that there is something interesting going on in the background. That sense is bolstered when you restore your wallet using your seed phrase. What is that sense? Can we unpack this a bit more for the user? A worthy challenge.

Initiated by Dana. Join via #[designathon-visualize](https://bitcoindesign.slack.com/archives/C0471PNDGGM).

fields.Name: Pod Tags: Tagging Podcasts With Notes
fields.Description:
Couple of years ago, I designed an app for fun to tag podcasts with notes. My main goal was to learn how to use figma and how I could use it to create a prototype. So I did that with the project: Pod Tags!

When I heard about the Legends of Lightning and Design Hackathon, I decided to repurpose it and conceptualize how I would integrate Lightning into it. I ended up landing on the idea of a marketplace for selling pod tags. If you have comments, user feedback, or want to collaborate on expanding/revamping Pod Tags, would love to collaborate together!

[Project overview video](https://youtu.be/0f0f3Mf-h0w)
[Clickable prototype](https://www.figma.com/proto/MpGIuYTjfFuGDDEUqslaNg/PodTag?node-id=45%3A349&scaling=scale-down&page-id=0%3A1&starting-point-node-id=45%3A349&show-proto-sidebar=1)

fields.Name: Redesign BTCPay Server merchant directory
fields.Description:
BTCPay Server is an open-source payment processor for bitcoin. Since it's decentralized and self-hosted there's no way to know who is really using BTCPay. However, merchants that use BTCPay sometimes proudly display it on their website or social media. To help various merchants advertise that they accept bitcoin and use btcpay, we've created a directory where anyone can self-list themselves. The goal of this project is to completely re-design and improve directory. Right now all the listings are on a single homepage with infinite scroll. We'd like to propose that every merchant has their own page. So redesigning the homepage, a submission page and a single merchant page would be the goal of this project.

Join the Slack channel here: [#designathon-btcpay](https://bitcoindesign.slack.com/archives/C044FHE2STB)

BTCPay Directory can be seen here [https://directory.btcpayserver.org](https://directory.btcpayserver.org/)
Our Design guidelines can be found here [https://design.btcpayserver.org](https://design.btcpayserver.org/)

Designers are completely free to make their own design choices, we'd love you to be creative and help merchants who accept bitcoin get more visibility.

fields.Name: gift.cash
fields.Description:
What is the problem we're trying to solve?

\- Many companies offer rewards to incentivize user behavior and engagement. E.g. Sign up for mailing lists, completing surveys, etc.
\- The rewards are usually in the form of Amazon US Gift Cards, VISA prepaid cards, Paypal Credits. Those gift cards might not be usable to some users (e.g. only valid in US). There are marketplaces that users sell gift cards with a discount in exchange for bitcoin.
\- There's currently no way for a non-technical person to give sats in batches to incentivize a user behavior.
\- Furthermore it's complicated to give BTC to a no-coiner.

How are we going to solve the problem?

\- We'll make it simple for a non-technical person/company to give bitcoin gift cards to their users, even if the user is a no-coiner.
\- A web app which a user may paste a list of emails, and in a click, create and send gift cards to all recipients; create and track gift card campaigns;
\- For technical users, we will offer an API integration.
A simple interface where anyone can redeem gift cards using LNURLw, learn about bitcoin and self-custody.

Initiated by Porto. Read the [LOL Week 1 update](https://makers.bolt.fun/story/ppps-week-1-giftcash-ux--206). Join via [#designathon-gift-cash](https://bitcoindesign.slack.com/archives/C046W27D1AQ).

fields.Name: Passing the buck
fields.Description:
How to hand bitcoin down to your family as seamlessly as possible? What happens if the bitcoiner in the family all of a sudden kicks the bucket? Who is going to assist the non-technical people and how? Could there be a website / platform that somehow guides the family member along the way, revealing certain information or directing them where to look? This team will be designing working on exactly this. 

Slack: [#designathon-inheritance](https://bitcoindesign.slack.com/archives/C0441TK0459)
